title: Multi-cloud solution architecture
query: Design the architecture for a B2B company that needs Sales Cloud for opportunity management, Service Cloud for case handling, and integration with an external ERP (SAP) for order fulfillment.
expected_behavior: Applies Well-Architected pillars (Trusted > Easy > Adaptable) in priority order
Recommends standard features before custom development
Identifies Account/Contact as unifying entities across clouds
Selects an appropriate integration pattern for SAP (likely Batch Data Sync or Event-Driven)
Documents data ownership for each entity (system of record)
Recommends OAuth 2.0 for SAP integration (not username/password)
Addresses OWD and sharing model
Includes environment strategy (Dev > QA > UAT > Production)
Produces or references a solution design structure

title: Data model review with anti-patterns
query: Review this data model: We have a single custom object Client__c with 450 fields that stores client info, billing data, support tickets, and project tracking. We use Profile-based security and Public Read/Write OWD.
expected_behavior: Flags God Object anti-pattern (Client__c with 450 fields serving multiple purposes)
Recommends splitting into separate objects (Client, Billing, Support, Project)
Flags Public Read/Write OWD as an anti-pattern (SE2)
Recommends most restrictive OWD and opening up with sharing rules
Flags Profile-centric security as anti-pattern (SE1)
Recommends permission sets and permission set groups
References Well-Architected Trusted pillar for security recommendations
Does NOT recommend hardcoded IDs

title: Automation strategy decision
query: We have a Process Builder and an Apex trigger both running on the Case object when a case is created. The Process Builder updates the case owner and the trigger sends a notification. We're seeing unexpected behavior. How should we fix this?
expected_behavior: Identifies mixed automation anti-pattern (AU2 — Flow + Apex trigger on same event)
Identifies deprecated Process Builder (AU3 — should migrate to Flow)
Recommends single automation path per object per event
Recommends migrating Process Builder to Flow
Suggests either Flow or Apex trigger handles both use cases, not both
References Order of Execution to explain unexpected behavior
Recommends Flow as the de-facto standard (unless complex logic requires Apex)
